title-part.text: RESONATORS, LINES, OR OTHER DEVICES OF THE WAVEGUIDE TYPE

reference.text: operating at optical frequencies G02B; aerials H01Q;

CPC-specific-text.text: modulating electromagnetic waves in transmission line, waveguide, cavity resonator or radiation field of aerial H03C7/02

reference.text: ; networks comprising lumped impedance elements H03H

note.note-paragraph:
In this subclass, the following expression is used with the meaning indicated :
- "waveguide type" as applied to transmission lines includes
only high-frequency coaxial cables or Lecher lines, and as
applied to resonators, delay lines, or other devices includes
all devices having distributed inductance and capacitance.

reference.text: coupling devices of the waveguide type H01P5/00
; line connectors H01R; cable fittings H02G15/00

CPC-specific-text.text: the relative movement being a translation along an axis common to at least two rectilinear parts, e.g. expansion joints
the relative movement being a rotation
with a limited angle of rotation
the axis of rotation being perpendicular to the transmission path, e.g. hinge joint
the axis of rotation being parallel to the transmission path, e.g. stepped twist
with an unlimited angle of rotation
the energy being transmitted in only one line located on the axis of rotation
the energy being transmitted in at least one ring-shaped transmission line located around the axis of rotation, e.g. "around the mast" rotary joint

reference.text: H01P1/069 takes precedence; coaxial line with solid inner conductor H01P1/067

CPC-specific-text.text: the energy being transmitted in at least one ring-shaped transmission line located around an axial transmission line; Concentric coaxial systems

reference.text: coupling devices for transit time tubes H01J23/36
in systems using reflection or reradiation of radio, acoustic or other waves G01S7/034

title-part.text: for mode selection, e.g. mode suppression or mode promotion

reference.text: linking dissimilar lines or devices H01P5/08

title-part.text: sustaining two independent orthogonal modes, e.g. orthomode transducer

reference.text: combining or separating polarisations and frequencies H01P1/2131

title-part.text: absorbing spurious or unwanted modes of propagation
specifically adapted for selection or promotion of the TE 01 circular-electric mode
for rotating the plane of polarisation
for producing a continuously rotating polarisation, e.g. circular polarisation

CPC-specific-text.text: using a corrugated or ridged waveguide section

reference.text: H01P1/165 takes precedence; coupling devices with variable coupling factor H01P5/04

title-part.text: using a diode or a gas filled discharge tube

CPC-specific-text.text: variable impedance transformers, e.g. slug tuners or stub tuners H01P5/04

reference.text: H01P1/212, H01P1/213, H01P1/215, H01P1/219 take precedence

CPC-specific-text.text: Filtering devices for biasing networks or DC returns
Slot line filters; Fin line filters
with dielectric resonators as non-metallised opposite openings in the metallised surfaces of a substrate
the coaxial cavity resonators being disposed parall to each other
Comb filters or interdigital filters with metallised resonator holes in a dielectric block

reference.text: H01P1/212, H01P1/213, H01P1/215, H01P1/219 take precedence

title-part.text: Cascaded resonators inside a hollow waveguide structure
comprising one or more branching arms or cavities wholly outside the main waveguide
combining or separating two or more different frequencies

CPC-specific-text.text: using comb or interdigital filters; using cascaded coaxial cavities

title-part.text: the ferromagnetic material acting as a tuning element in resonators
the ferromagnetic material acting as a frequency selective coupling element, e.g. YIG-filters

CPC-specific-text.text: the dissipative medium being a liquid or being cooled by a liquid

reference.text: coupling devices with variable coupling factor H01P5/04

title-part.text: for compensation of, or protection against, temperature or moisture effects;
Transmission lines of the waveguide type
Lines formed as Lecher wire pairs

reference.text: not suitable for handling frequencies considerably beyond the audio range,

note.note-paragraph: This subgroup is only used for documents disclosing typical HF-features of coaxial cables, e.g. propagation of non-TEM-modes, multimoding, oversized coaxial cables, particular cross-section adapted for HF-propagation

title-part.text: Wire waveguides, i.e. with a single solid longitudinal conductor
with a complex or stepped cross-section, e.g. ridged or grooved waveguides
with a circular, elliptic, or parabolic cross-section
specially adapted for transmission of the TE01 circular-electric mode
Dielectric waveguides, i.e. without a longitudinal conductor
built-up from several layers to increase operating surface, i.e. alternately conductive and dielectric layers
Quasi-optical arrangements for guiding a wave, e.g. focusing by dielectric lenses
Coupling devices of the waveguide type

reference.text: non-reciprocal devices H01P1/32; for introducing or removing wave energy to or from the discharge in transit-time tubes H01J23/36

CPC-specific-text.text: Transitions between lines of the same kind and shape, but with different dimensions

title-part.text: for linking dissimilar lines or devices

reference.text: H01P1/16, H01P5/04 take precedence; linking lines of the same kind but with different dimensions H01P5/02

CPC-specific-text.text: Transitions between hollow waveguides of different shape, e.g. between a rectangular and a circular waveguide

title-part.text: for coupling balanced with unbalanced lines or devices

CPC-specific-text.text: Microstrip transitions to Slotline or finline
Coplanar line transitions to Slotline or finline

title-part.text: Coupling devices having more than two ports
Conjugate devices, i.e. devices having at least one port decoupled from one other port
consisting of two coupled guides, e.g. directional couplers

CPC-specific-text.text: the waveguides being arranged in parallel
at least one of the guides being a coaxial line
the guides being strip lines or microstrips

reference.text: ; structurally associated with transit-time tubes and interacting with the discharge therein H01J23/18;

CPC-specific-text.text: generators of electronic oscillations using resonators of this type H03B5/18, H03B7/14, H03B9/14; electronic amplifiers using resonators of this type H03F3/54

title-part.text: Delay lines of the waveguide type

reference.text: structurally associated with transit-time tubes and interacting with the discharge therein H01J23/24

title-part.text: Apparatus or processes specially adapted for manufacturing waveguides or resonators, lines, or other devices of the waveguide type

CPC-specific-text.text: Manufacturing waveguides or transmission lines of the waveguide type
Manufacturing lines with conductors on a substrate, e.g. strip lines, slot lines
